docs.lead_paragraph: A Canadian wealth management firm has won last month's charity auction of a steak lunch with Warren E. Buffett, in which it agreed to pay $1,680,300 to dine with the world's second-richest person, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Buffett Lunch Auction Won by Canadian Firm

docs.abstract: A Canadian wealth management firm, Salida Capital, has won the charity auction of a steak lunch with Warren E. Buffett, in which it agreed to pay $1,680,300 to dine with him.

docs.lead_paragraph: After months of anticipation -- and hand-wringing that it's no longer needed -- the Public-Private Investment Partnership has finally been introduced.

headline.main: Treasury Picks Nine Managers for P.P.I.P.

docs.abstract: The federal government finally made known the terms of the Public-Private Investment Partnership, including the naming of nine managers to buy bad loans from troubled financial firms.
docs.snippet: The federal government finally made known the terms of the Public-Private Investment Partnership, including the naming of nine managers to buy bad loans from troubled financial firms.

docs.lead_paragraph: Charges of bribery, insurance fraud and money laundering are at the heart of indictments against 14 New York health care workers -- two of them employees of the city-run Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center in the Bronx -- that were disclosed on Wednesday.

headline.main: Cuomo Charges 14 in Health Care Fraud Scheme

docs.abstract: The cases center on two small clinics run by a Queens businessman, Daniel Levy, who is alleged to have paid a lawyer to bribe hospital officials to give out confidential patient information.
docs.snippet: The cases center on two small clinics run by a Queens businessman, Daniel Levy, who is alleged to have paid a lawyer to bribe hospital officials to give out confidential patient information.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Small Business Majority released a series of state polls today and yesterday that make an astonishing claim: small-business owners, by wide majorities, support a mandate that would require that businesses either provide health insurance for their employees or pay a tax to fund government-supported insurance for them. In Iowa, 65 percent support the pay-or-play proposal; in Nebraska, 59 percent favor it. Across 16 states, support for the employer mandate ranges from 59 percent to 72 percent

headline.main: Who Is the Small Business Majority?

docs.abstract: The organization has gotten a lot of press this spring, first as one of two small business invitees to the White House health care summit in March. But just what is Small Business Majority, and whom does it really represent?
